20110129010426.000|20110129010429.000|TR0|major police stations have been ransacked. 
20110129010429.000|20110129010431.000|TR0| The police as we saw in one of the police 
20110129010431.000|20110129010434.000|TR0|stations just behind our bureau, the 
20110129010434.000|20110129010436.000|TR0|policemen hid inside their barracks while 
20110129010436.000|20110129010439.000|TR0|the crowd outside was trying to crash down 
20110129010439.000|20110129010441.000|TR0|the door.
20110129010441.000|20110129010444.000|TR0|
20110129010444.000|20110129010446.000|TR0|Many of them changed into civilian 
20110129010446.000|20110129010449.000|TR0|clothing and ran away.  The worry of many 
20110129010449.000|20110129010451.000|TR0|Egyptians is in the absence of any police 
20110129010451.000|20110129010454.000|TR0|the danger of looting, the danger of 
20110129010454.000|20110129010456.000|TR0|absolute chaos.  And that explains one of 
20110129010456.000|20110129010459.000|TR0|the reason yes people have been so happy 
20110129010459.000|20110129010501.000|TR0|to see the army come out.
20110129010501.000|20110129010504.000|TR0|
20110129010504.000|20110129010506.000|TR0|Because the army is not associated with 
20110129010506.000|20110129010509.000|TR0|many of the excesses of the police, like 
20110129010509.000|20110129010511.000|TR0|brutality, like arbitrary arrests, like 
20110129010511.000|20110129010514.000|TR0|simply rounding up people in certain 
20110129010514.000|20110129010516.000|TR0|neighborhoods.  So relief that the army is 
20110129010516.000|20110129010519.000|TR0|out, but certainly politically the 
20110129010519.000|20110129010521.000|TR0|situation is very unclear.

20110129010709.000|20110129010711.000|TR0|that the cabinet functions at the whims of 
20110129010711.000|20110129010714.000|TR0|the president.  The president has the 
20110129010714.000|20110129010716.000|TR0|power in Egypt.  The cabinet merely deals

20110129010719.000|20110129010721.000|TR0|not determine policy. So it's just window

20110129010854.000|20110129010856.000|TR0|he did not say Mubarak.  Has that word 
20110129010856.000|20110129010859.000|TR0|trickled down to the street?
20110129010859.000|20110129010901.000|TR0|
20110129010901.000|20110129010904.000|TR0|WEDEMAN:  Well, people are aware.  This 
20110129010904.000|20110129010906.000|TR0|has sort of been hinted at over the last 
20110129010906.000|20110129010909.000|TR0|few days that the U.S. is slowly,

20110129010911.000|20110129010914.000|TR0|administration, which it supported so

20110129010916.000|20110129010919.000|TR0|
20110129010919.000|20110129010921.000|TR0|But the reaction seems to be why now does 
20110129010921.000|20110129010924.000|TR0|-- do the human rights of the Egyptian 
20110129010924.000|20110129010926.000|TR0|people matter when since 1981, it rarely 
20110129010926.000|20110129010929.000|TR0|seemed to be an issue in bilateral 
20110129010929.000|20110129010931.000|TR0|relations.  In fact, there is a certain 
20110129010931.000|20110129010934.000|TR0|simmering resentment at the United States.
20110129010934.000|20110129010936.000|TR0|
20110129010936.000|20110129010939.000|TR0|For instance, one young man came up to me 
20110129010939.000|20110129010941.000|TR0|and he showed me the tear gas canisters 
20110129010941.000|20110129010944.000|TR0|that have been so liberally used over 
20110129010944.000|20110129010946.000|TR0|recent days. And it said made in the USA 
20110129010946.000|20110129010949.000|TR0|and they all point that out.  And we must 
20110129010949.000|20110129010951.000|TR0|-- I mean if you look at modern Middle 
20110129010951.000|20110129010954.000|TR0|Eastern history, in terms of potential 
20110129010954.000|20110129010956.000|TR0|setbacks for American policy in the Middle 
20110129010956.000|20110129010959.000|TR0|East you can only -- the only comparison 
20110129010959.000|20110129011001.000|TR0|is the fall of the shah of Iran in 1979 in 
20110129011001.000|20110129011003.000|TR0|terms of political significance.
20110129011003.000|20110129011006.000|TR0|
20110129011006.000|20110129011008.000|TR0|Egyptian people don't have the well of 
20110129011008.000|20110129011011.000|TR0|resentment that the Iranians did as a 
20110129011011.000|20110129011013.000|TR0|result of U.S. support for the shah, but 
20110129011013.000|20110129011016.000|TR0|there is intense awareness that the United 
20110129011016.000|20110129011018.000|TR0|States and one president after another 
20110129011018.000|20110129011021.000|TR0|were always enthusiastic backers of 
20110129011021.000|20110129011023.000|TR0|President Hosni Mubarak.
20110129011023.000|20110129011026.000|TR0|

20110129011036.000|20110129011038.000|TR0|into.  We'll be back with you in a bit.
20110129011038.000|20110129011041.000|TR0|
20110129011041.000|20110129011043.000|TR0|Now we turn to story of Steven Graves who 
20110129011043.000|20110129011046.000|TR0|has not heard from his 18-year-old 
20110129011046.000|20110129011048.000|TR0|daughter Courtney since Thursday morning.  
20110129011048.000|20110129011051.000|TR0|She's studying in Egypt and he's at home 
20110129011051.000|20110129011053.000|TR0|in New Hampshire worried and waiting.
20110129011053.000|20110129011056.000|TR0|
20110129011056.000|20110129011058.000|TR0|PARKER:  Courtney is fluent in Arabic.  
20110129011058.000|20110129011101.000|TR0|She loves the culture and the people.  Her 
20110129011101.000|20110129011103.000|TR0|last blog posting was dated Wednesday and 
20110129011103.000|20110129011106.000|TR0|it was titled, quote, "uprising" and 
20110129011106.000|20110129011108.000|TR0|included this.  Emotions were so high and 
20110129011108.000|20110129011111.000|TR0|passion so great it was almost tangible.  
20110129011111.000|20110129011113.000|TR0|I've never seen men so angry, yet so happy 
20110129011113.000|20110129011116.000|TR0|to be expressing their anger.  I walked 
20110129011116.000|20110129011118.000|TR0|next to girls in Hijabs -- those are the 
20110129011118.000|20110129011121.000|TR0|Islamic headscarves -- screaming for the

20110129013317.000|20110129013320.000|TR0|
20110129013320.000|20110129013322.000|TR0|SPITZER:  We're back with breaking news 
20110129013322.000|20110129013325.000|TR0|coverage of events in Cairo, joined again 
20110129013325.000|20110129013327.000|TR0|by James Traub and Irshad Manji.  The 
20110129013327.000|20110129013330.000|TR0|events we have been watching unfold in 
20110129013330.000|20110129013332.000|TR0|Egypt have largely been shaped by what 
20110129013332.000|20110129013335.000|TR0|those on the street have seen on their 
20110129013335.000|20110129013337.000|TR0|computer genes.  Facebook, Twitter and 
20110129013337.000|20110129013340.000|TR0|other forms of social media have 
20110129013340.000|20110129013342.000|TR0|accelerated how the news travels and how 
20110129013342.000|20110129013345.000|TR0|the movement has grown.

20110129014454.000|20110129014457.000|TR0|TV, this thing that never existed before,

20110129014459.000|20110129014502.000|TR0|everything that's happening, no matter

20110129015344.000|20110129015346.000|TR0|hostile toward Iran.  They are hostile to 
20110129015346.000|20110129015349.000|TR0|Hezbollah.       They also control a key 
20110129015349.000|20110129015351.000|TR0|shipping point for the world's oil.  And 
20110129015351.000|20110129015354.000|TR0|that also is a matter of strategic 
20110129015354.000|20110129015356.000|TR0|concern.  So one reason why the Obama 
20110129015356.000|20110129015359.000|TR0|administration has been so restrained in

20110129015434.000|20110129015436.000|TR0|MANJI:  Simply put that history shows that 
20110129015436.000|20110129015439.000|TR0|so often the rhetoric of democracy is what 
20110129015439.000|20110129015441.000|TR0|people follow as opposed to truly 
20110129015441.000|20110129015444.000|TR0|understanding what the people they follow 
20110129015444.000|20110129015446.000|TR0|are about.  We saw this with Ayatollah 
20110129015446.000|20110129015449.000|TR0|Khomeini.  He spoke a good game about 
20110129015449.000|20110129015451.000|TR0|democracy and look what happened after he 
20110129015451.000|20110129015454.000|TR0|came to power.  We saw this with Hamas.  
20110129015454.000|20110129015456.000|TR0|They spoke a good game about being

20110129015511.000|20110129015514.000|TR0|Egypt have come to understand that.  But

20110129015516.000|20110129015519.000|TR0|the alternative is in order to really

20110129015529.000|20110129015531.000|TR0|would help reignite the green revolution 
20110129015531.000|20110129015534.000|TR0|in Iran?
20110129015534.000|20110129015536.000|TR0|
20110129015536.000|20110129015539.000|TR0|MANJI:  It's a fascinating question.  And 
20110129015539.000|20110129015541.000|TR0|here's what I would say about that.  It is 
20110129015541.000|20110129015544.000|TR0|possible, but keep in mind that most of 
20110129015544.000|20110129015546.000|TR0|the Arab world is Sunni whereas Iran is 
20110129015546.000|20110129015549.000|TR0|Shia.  And in the Shia mythology is the 
20110129015549.000|20110129015551.000|TR0|sense that sometimes the moral victory is 
20110129015551.000|20110129015554.000|TR0|all you need and the political victory 
20110129015554.000|20110129015556.000|TR0|will be saved for the hereafter.
20110129015556.000|20110129015559.000|TR0|
20110129015559.000|20110129015601.000|TR0|I'm not saying that Iranians succumb to 
20110129015601.000|20110129015604.000|TR0|fatalism, not at all. But there is that 
20110129015604.000|20110129015606.000|TR0|mythology that props up this notion that, 
20110129015606.000|20110129015609.000|TR0|you know, if we rise up, then god will do 
20110129015609.000|20110129015611.000|TR0|the rest.  And I am not so sure, 
20110129015611.000|20110129015614.000|TR0|therefore, that we can make strong
